languages.text: "Речь этих прихожан хорошо поставлена — значит, часто говорят на аудиторию, возможно, приказывают и облечены властью. Да и признаться, столько я исповедей откатегоризовал, что выучился различать тонкую разницу между ними".

traits.locale_text: "Речь этих прихожан хорошо поставлена — значит, часто говорят на аудиторию, возможно, приказывают и облечены властью. Да и признаться, столько я исповедей откатегоризовал, что выучился различать тонкую разницу между ними".

languages.text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."
languages.original_text: "Речь этих прихожан хорошо поставлена — значит, часто говорят на аудиторию, возможно, приказывают и облечены властью. Да и признаться, столько я исповедей откатегоризовал, что выучился различать тонкую разницу между ними".

traits.locale_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

"Those parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they often speak to an audience; perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power." {n}The acolyte continues more slowly, carefully weighing his words.{/n} "They could be, say, senior officers."

"These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

"These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

"These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

"These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

languages.text: « À en juger par leur excellente élocution, je pense que ces paroissiens ont l'habitude de s'adresser à un public. Ce sont peut-être des gens qui donnent des ordres et disposent d'une certaine autorité. À force de passer mon temps à classer les confessions, j'ai appris à remarquer les subtiles différences qui les distinguent les unes des autres. »
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

traits.locale_text: « À en juger par leur excellente élocution, je pense que ces paroissiens ont l'habitude de s'adresser à un public. Ce sont peut-être des gens qui donnent des ordres et disposent d'une certaine autorité. À force de passer mon temps à classer les confessions, j'ai appris à remarquer les subtiles différences qui les distinguent les unes des autres. »

« À en juger par leur excellente élocution, je pense que ces paroissiens ont l'habitude de s'adresser à un public. Ce sont peut-être des gens qui donnent des ordres et disposent d'une certaine autorité. Il pourrait s'agir, par exemple... d'officiers supérieurs, » {n}ajoute l'initié plus lentement, en pesant ses mots avec précaution.{/n}

languages.text: «Los feligreses en cuestión hablan bien, lo que indica que están acostumbrados a dirigirse a un grupo. Es posible que para dar órdenes investidas de autoridad. Además, después de catalogar suficientes confesiones, uno aprende a ver las ligeras diferencias que hay entre ellas».
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

traits.locale_text: «Los feligreses en cuestión hablan bien, lo que indica que están acostumbrados a dirigirse a un grupo. Es posible que para dar órdenes investidas de autoridad. Además, después de catalogar suficientes confesiones, uno aprende a ver las ligeras diferencias que hay entre ellas».

«La dicción de estos feligreses es impecable, así que han de tener dotes de oratoria. Tal vez estén acostumbrados a impartir órdenes y ostenten un cargo de autoridad». {n}El iniciado hace una pausa antes de continuar para escoger sus palabras con cautela.{/n} «Digamos que podrían ser... oficiales de una cierta veteranía».

languages.text: “这几位教区居民说话口齿非常清晰，这意味着他们习惯于对许多人说话。或许他们位高权重，经常发布命令。而且，这么说吧，我整理过无数份告解词，能留意到它们之间的细微差别。”
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

traits.locale_text: “这几位教区居民说话口齿非常清晰，这意味着他们习惯于对许多人说话。或许他们位高权重，经常发布命令。而且，这么说吧，我整理过无数份告解词，能留意到它们之间的细微差别。”
“这几位教区居民说话口齿非常清晰，这意味着他们习惯于对许多人说话。或许他们位高权重，经常发布命令。”{n}助祭的话说得更慢了，仔细斟酌着他的用词。{/n}“他们有可能是……比如说……高阶军官。”

languages.text: 「これらの教区民は口が達者で、聴衆を前にして演説することに慣れています。おそらく命令を下し、権力を握っているのでしょう。そして、その、数多くの告白を分類しているうちに、それぞれの微妙な違いに気づくようになったのです」
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

traits.locale_text: 「これらの教区民は口が達者で、聴衆を前にして演説することに慣れています。おそらく命令を下し、権力を握っているのでしょう。そして、その、数多くの告白を分類しているうちに、それぞれの微妙な違いに気づくようになったのです」
「これらの教区民は口が達者で、聴衆を前にして演説することに慣れている。おそらく命令を下し、権力を握っているのでしょう」 {n}イニシエイトは言葉を慎重に発し、ゆっくりと続ける。{/n}「彼らは例えば…上級士官かもしれない」

languages.text: "Diese Gemeindemitglieder wissen sich auszudrücken. Sie sind es also gewohnt, vor Publikum zu sprechen. Vielleicht erteilen sie Befehle oder besitzen Autorität. Und angesichts der vielen Beichten, die ich bereits kategorisiert habe, erkenne ich die subtilen Unterschiede.
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."

traits.locale_text: "Diese Gemeindemitglieder wissen sich auszudrücken. Sie sind es also gewohnt, vor Publikum zu sprechen. Vielleicht erteilen sie Befehle oder besitzen Autorität. Und angesichts der vielen Beichten, die ich bereits kategorisiert habe, erkenne ich die subtilen Unterschiede.

"Diese Gemeindemitglieder wissen sich auszudrücken, sie sind es also gewohnt, vor Publikum zu sprechen. Vielleicht erteilen sie Befehle oder besitzen Autorität." {n}Der Eingeweihte fährt etwas langsamer fort, wägt seine Worte vorsichtig ab.{/n} "Es könnten, sagen wir ... hochrangige Offiziere sein."

languages.text: "Cemaatimizin bu üyelerinin sözlü iletişim yeteneği yüksek, yani çok sayıda kişiye hitap etmeye alışıklar. Belki de emir vermekteler ve ellerinde güç barındırmaktalar. Ve ayrıca bu kadar çok itiraf kategorize etmem sayesinde aralarındaki ince farkları görebilir hâle gelmeyi öğrendim."
languages.original_text: "These parishioners are well-spoken, meaning they are used to addressing an audience. Perhaps they issue orders and are vested with power. And, well, after categorising so many confessions, I have learned to notice the subtle differences between them."
